cards.name: Ancestor's Chosen
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
When Ancestor's Chosen enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each card in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Empowered by generations of strength.
cards.original_text:
First strike
When Ancestor's Chosen comes into play, you gain 1 life for each card in your graveyard.

cards.name: Aven Warcraft
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, choose a color. Creatures you control also gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.
cards.original_text:
Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.
Threshold Creatures you control also gain protection from the color of your choice until end of turn. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

foreign_names.name: Art de la guerre des avemains

cards.name: Battle Screech
cards.text:
Create two 1/1 white Bird creature tokens with flying.
Flashback—Tap three untapped white creatures you control. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Put two 1/1 white Bird creature tokens with flying into play.
Flashback—Tap three untapped white creatures you control. (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Battlewise Aven
cards.text:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Battlewise Aven gets +1/+1 and has first strike.
cards.flavor: Experience is a good teacher, not a kind one.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Threshold Battlewise Aven gets +1/+1 and has first strike. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Benevolent Bodyguard
cards.text: Sacrifice Benevolent Bodyguard: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "My destiny is to save others so their destinies may be achieved."
cards.original_text: Sacrifice Benevolent Bodyguard: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Border Patrol
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor:
"We have been victims of treachery, of the Cabal, and of our own ambitions. No more."
—Commander Eesha
cards.original_text: Attacking doesn't cause Border Patrol to tap.

cards.name: Cagemail
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't attack.
cards.flavor:
"Power often costs too high a price."
—Commander Eesha
cards.original_text: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't attack.

cards.name: Chastise
cards.text: Destroy target attacking creature. You gain life equal to its power.
cards.flavor:
"Why do we pray to the Ancestor? Because She listens."
—Mystic elder
cards.original_text: Destroy target attacking creature. You gain life equal to its power.

cards.name: Commander Eesha
cards.text: Flying, protection from creatures
cards.flavor: "War glides on the simplest updrafts while peace struggles against hurricane winds. It is the way of the world. It must change."
cards.original_text: Flying, protection from creatures

cards.name: Funeral Pyre
cards.text: Exile target card from a graveyard. Its owner creates a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Raze the body. Raise the soul."
—Mystic elder
cards.original_text: Remove target card in a graveyard from the game. Its owner puts a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying into play.

cards.name: Glory
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{W}: Choose a color. Creatures you control gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn. Activate this ability only if Glory is in your graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Glory was gone; Glory was everywhere."
—Scroll of Beginnings
cards.original_text:
Flying
{2}{W}: Creatures you control gain protection from the color of your choice until end of turn. Play this ability only if Glory is in your graveyard.

cards.name: Golden Wish
cards.text: You may choose an artifact or enchantment card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Golden Wish.
cards.flavor: She wished for nobility, but not for a nation to honor it.
cards.original_text: Choose an artifact or enchantment card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Remove Golden Wish from the game.

rulings.text: Can't acquire the Ante cards. They are considered still "in the game" as are cards in the library and the graveyard.
Can't acquire cards that are phased out.
You can't acquire exiled cards because those cards are still in one of the game's zones.
In a sanctioned event, a card that's "outside the game" is one that's in your sideboard. In an unsanctioned event, you may choose any card from your collection.

cards.name: Guided Strike
cards.text:
Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"May the Ancestor strengthen my hand and guide my blade."
—Nomad war prayer
cards.original_text:
Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
Draw a card.

rulings.text: If the creature is an illegal target when Guided Strike tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't draw a card.

cards.name: Lead Astray
cards.text: Tap up to two target creatures.
cards.flavor:
"Never underestimate our enemy's strength, brutality, . . . or stupidity."
—Commander Eesha
cards.original_text: Tap up to two target creatures.

cards.name: Nomad Mythmaker
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Put target Aura card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control attached to a creature you control.
cards.flavor: Nomads weave tales thicker than tapestries.
cards.original_text: {W}, {T}: Put target enchant creature card from a graveyard into play enchanting a creature you control. (You control that enchantment.)

rulings.text: You don't choose which creature the Aura will enter the battlefield attached to until the ability resolves. You must choose a creature the Aura can legally enchant. (For example, you can't choose a creature with protection from black if the targeted Aura card is black.) If you don't control any creatures that the Aura can enchant, it remains in the graveyard.
Nomad Mythmaker's ability can target an Aura card in any graveyard, not just yours.

cards.name: Phantom Flock
cards.text:
Flying
Phantom Flock enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Flock, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Flock.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Phantom Flock comes into play with three +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Flock, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Flock.

rulings.text: If this card takes damage from multiple sources at once (for example if it is blocked by multiple creatures in combat), it only loses one counter.
If unpreventable damage is applied to this card, you still remove a counter even though the prevention fails.
Remove one counter each time it would be damaged. If it was going to take more than one point of damage, you prevent all the damage and still only remove one counter.
The damage prevention ability works even if it has no counters, as long as some effect keeps its toughness above zero.

cards.name: Phantom Nomad
cards.text:
Phantom Nomad enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Nomad, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Nomad.
cards.original_text:
Phantom Nomad comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Nomad, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Nomad.

rulings.text: If this card takes damage from multiple sources at once (for example if it is blocked by multiple creatures in combat), it only loses one counter.
If unpreventable damage is applied to this card, you still remove a counter even though the prevention fails.
Remove one counter each time it would be damaged. If it was going to take more than one point of damage, you prevent all the damage and still only remove one counter.
The damage prevention ability works even if it has no counters, as long as some effect keeps its toughness above zero.

cards.name: Prismatic Strands
cards.text:
Prevent all damage that sources of the color of your choice would deal this turn.
Flashback—Tap an untapped white creature you control. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Prevent all damage that sources of the color of your choice would deal this turn.
Flashback—Tap an untapped white creature you control. (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Pulsemage Advocate
cards.text: {T}: Return three target cards from an opponent's graveyard to their hand. Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Our unity revives our hopes."
cards.original_text: {T}: Return three target cards in an opponent's graveyard to his or her hand.  Return target creature card from your graveyard to play.

rulings.text: You can't activate this ability unless a single opponent has at least three cards in their graveyard to target and you have a creature card in your graveyard to target.

cards.name: Ray of Revelation
cards.text:
Destroy target enchantment.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: Webs of illusion unravel in the light of truth.
cards.original_text:
Destroy target enchantment.
Flashback {G} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Selfless Exorcist
cards.text: {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. That card deals damage equal to its power to Selfless Exorcist.
cards.original_text: {T}: Remove target creature card in a graveyard from the game. That card deals damage equal to its power to Selfless Exorcist. (A * on a card not in play is 0.)

rulings.text: The reminder text printed on Selfless Exorcist is no longer correct. Abilities that define a creature's power (and toughness) apply in every zone. The value of * is defined by such an ability.

cards.name: Shieldmage Advocate
cards.text: {T}: Return target card from an opponent's graveyard to their hand. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to any target this turn by a source of your choice.
cards.flavor: "Our unity conquers all fears."
cards.original_text: {T}: Return target card in an opponent's graveyard to his or her hand. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn by a source of your choice.

cards.name: Silver Seraph
cards.text:
Flying
Threshold — Other creatures you control get +2/+2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: A symbol of hope for hopeless times.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Threshold Other creatures you control get +2/+2. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Solitary Confinement
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Solitary Confinement unless you discard a card.
Skip your draw step.
You have shroud. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you.
cards.original_text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Solitary Confinement unless you discard a card from your hand.
Skip your draw step.
You can't be the target of spells or abilities.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you.

cards.name: Soulcatchers' Aerie
cards.text:
Whenever a Bird is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, put a feather counter on Soulcatchers' Aerie.
Bird creatures get +1/+1 for each feather counter on Soulcatchers' Aerie.
cards.original_text:
Whenever a Bird is put into your graveyard from play, put a feather counter on Soulcatchers' Aerie.
All Birds get +1/+1 for each feather counter on Soulcatchers' Aerie.

foreign_names.name: Ce qui attrape des âmes aéraines

cards.name: Spirit Cairn
cards.text: Whenever a player discards a card, you may pay {W}. If you do, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
cards.flavor: It marks the border between here and hereafter.
cards.original_text: Whenever a player discards a card from his or her hand, you may pay {W}. If you do, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying into play.

cards.name: Spurnmage Advocate
cards.text: {T}: Return two target cards from an opponent's graveyard to their hand. Destroy target attacking creature.
cards.flavor: "Our unity humbles our foes."
cards.original_text: {T}: Return two target cards in an opponent's graveyard to his or her hand. Destroy target attacking creature.

rulings.text: The ability is not countered if both cards are missing from the graveyard on resolution and the creature target is there. This makes it possible to have two Spurnmage Advocates both target the same two cards and end up destroying two creatures.
You can't activate this ability unless a single opponent has at least two cards in their graveyard to target.

cards.name: Suntail Hawk
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"Our forebears once flew like this—carefree, needing nothing but a warm nest and a full belly. Our intellect may be more burden than blessing."
—Commander Eesha
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Test of Endurance
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 50 or more life, you win the game.
cards.flavor:
"If we have learned nothing else, we have learned to survive."
—Mystic elder
cards.original_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 50 or more life, you win the game.

rulings.text: To win the game, you must have 50 or more life both at the beginning of upkeep and when the ability resolves.

cards.name: Trained Pronghorn
cards.text: Discard a card: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Trained Pronghorn this turn.
cards.flavor:
"The desert asked the Ancestor for children, and the antelope were born."
—Nomad myth
cards.original_text: Discard a card from your hand: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Trained Pronghorn this turn.

cards.name: Unquestioned Authority
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Unquestioned Authority enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has protection from creatures.
cards.flavor:
"Only the Ancestor should be revered."
—Mystic heretic
cards.original_text:
When Unquestioned Authority comes into play, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has protection from creatures.

cards.name: Valor
cards.text:
First strike
As long as Valor is in your graveyard and you control a Plains, creatures you control have first strike.
cards.flavor:
"The cracks widened, the shell crumbled, and Valor spread throughout the land."
—Scroll of Beginnings
cards.original_text:
First strike
As long as Valor is in your graveyard and you control a plains, creatures you control have first strike.

cards.name: Vigilant Sentry
cards.text: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Vigilant Sentry gets +1/+1 and has "{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn."
cards.original_text: Threshold Vigilant Sentry gets +1/+1 and has "{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn." (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Aven Fogbringer
cards.text:
Flying
When Aven Fogbringer enters the battlefield, return target land to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "I cover the land with blankets and it sleeps."
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Aven Fogbringer comes into play, return target land to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Cephalid Constable
cards.text: Whenever Cephalid Constable deals combat damage to a player, return up to that many target permanents that player controls to their owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Cephalids don't police people. They police loyalties.
cards.original_text: Whenever Cephalid Constable deals combat damage to a player, return up to X target permanents that player controls to their owners' hands, where X is the damage it dealt to that player.

cards.name: Cephalid Inkshrouder
cards.text: Discard a card: Cephalid Inkshrouder gains shroud until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn. (A creature with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: Cephalids shrink from the harsh glare of scrutiny.
cards.original_text: Discard a card from your hand: Cephalid Inkshrouder can't be the target of spells or abilities and is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Cunning Wish
cards.text: You may choose an instant card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Cunning Wish.
cards.flavor: He wished for knowledge, but not for the will to apply it.
cards.original_text: Choose an instant card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Remove Cunning Wish from the game.

rulings.text: Can't acquire the Ante cards. They are considered still "in the game" as are cards in the library and the graveyard.
The choice is optional.
If you fail to find something, you still exile this.
Can't acquire cards that are phased out.
You can't acquire exiled cards because those cards are still in one of the game's zones.
In a sanctioned event, a card that's "outside the game" is one that's in your sideboard. In an unsanctioned event, you may choose any card from your collection.

cards.name: Defy Gravity
cards.text:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Flashback {U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: Magical or not, it's still a cloud.
cards.original_text:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Flashback {U} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Envelop
cards.text: Counter target sorcery spell.
cards.flavor:
"What you made will be unmade. What you learned will be unlearned. And when you're done, you will be undone."
—Ambassador Laquatus
cards.original_text: Counter target sorcery spell.

cards.name: Flash of Insight
cards.text:
Look at the top X cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
Flashback—{1}{U}, Exile X blue cards from your graveyard. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost, then exile it. You can't exile Flash of Insight to pay for its own flashback cost.)
cards.original_text:
Look at the top X cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library.
Flashback—{1}{U}, Remove X blue cards in your graveyard from the game. (You can't remove Flash of Insight to pay for its own flashback cost.)

cards.name: Grip of Amnesia
cards.text:
Counter target spell unless its controller exiles all cards from their graveyard.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Would you abandon your past to save your future?"
—Ambassador Laquatus
cards.original_text:
Counter target spell unless its controller removes his or her graveyard from the game.
Draw a card.

rulings.text: You can choose to exile all cards from your graveyard even if it has no cards in it.

cards.name: Hapless Researcher
cards.text: Sacrifice Hapless Researcher: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: Scholars possess such lofty knowledge that it shouldn't be surprising when they fall.
cards.original_text: Sacrifice Hapless Researcher: Draw a card, then discard a card from your hand.

cards.name: Keep Watch
cards.text: Draw a card for each attacking creature.
cards.flavor: "I see their moral dilemmas. I see their raw courage. I see their self-sacrifice. I see our victory."
cards.original_text: Draw a card for each attacking creature.

cards.name: Laquatus's Disdain
cards.text:
Counter target spell cast from a graveyard.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "The first time was amusing, but now you're getting tiresome."
cards.original_text:
Counter target spell played from a graveyard.
Draw a card.

rulings.text: Can be used to counter a spell cast using the Flashback ability, or cast from the graveyard using any other effect.

cards.name: Lost in Thought
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated. Its controller may exile three cards from their graveyard for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.
cards.original_text: Enchanted creature can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be played. Its controller may remove three cards in his or her graveyard from the game to ignore this ability until end of turn.

rulings.text: You can take the "exile three cards" action any time you have priority without using the stack.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.name: Mental Note
cards.text:
Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Some minds are more open than others.
cards.original_text:
Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Mirror Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{W}: Mirror Wall can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.
cards.flavor:
"Breaking it would be about four hundred years bad luck."
—Nomad sentry
cards.original_text:
(Walls can't attack.)
{W}: Mirror Wall may attack this turn as though it weren't a Wall.

cards.name: Mist of Stagnation
cards.text:
Permanents don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses a permanent for each card in their graveyard, then untaps those permanents.
cards.original_text:
Permanents don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps a permanent for each card in his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Quiet Speculation
cards.text: Search target player's library for up to three cards with flashback and put them into that player's graveyard. Then the player shuffles their library.
cards.flavor:
"The best foresight is hindsight."
—Empress Llawan
cards.original_text: Search target player's library for up to three cards with flashback and put them into that player's graveyard. Then the player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Scalpelexis
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Scalpelexis deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top four cards of their library. If two or more of those cards have the same name, repeat this process.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Whenever Scalpelexis deals combat damage to a player, that player removes the top four cards of his or her library from the game. If two or more of those cards have the same name, repeat this process.

rulings.text: The "repeat this process" means to repeat as often as it takes to not get a matching pair.

cards.name: Spelljack
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard. You may play it without paying its mana cost for as long as it remains exiled. (If it has X in its mana cost, X is 0.)
cards.original_text: Counter target spell. If it's countered this way, remove it from the game instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard. As long as it remains removed from the game, you may play it as though it were in your hand without paying its mana cost. If it has X in its mana cost, X is 0.

rulings.text: If you cast an instant or sorcery, it goes to its owner's graveyard when it resolves.
This spell can be used on a spell cast using Flashback.

If you use this on an opponent's spell which has Buyback, you may pay the Buyback cost as you cast it. If you do so, the card will go to its owner's hand upon resolution. It will not go to your hand, nor to any player's graveyard.

cards.name: Telekinetic Bonds
cards.text: Whenever a player discards a card, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, you may tap or untap target permanent.
cards.flavor:
"Nature's been fired. The oceans are under new management."
—Ambassador Laquatus
cards.original_text: Whenever a player discards a card from his or her hand, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, tap or untap target permanent.

cards.name: Web of Inertia
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on each opponent's turn, that player may exile a card from their graveyard. If the player doesn't, creatures they control can't attack you this turn.
cards.flavor: Cephalids specialize in lose-lose situations.
cards.original_text: At the beginning of each opponent's combat phase, that player may remove a card in his or her graveyard from the game. If the player doesn't, creatures he or she controls can't attack you this turn.

rulings.text: Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can't attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

cards.name: Wonder
cards.text:
Flying
As long as Wonder is in your graveyard and you control an Island, creatures you control have flying.
cards.flavor:
"The awestruck birds gazed at Wonder. Slowly, timidly, they rose into the air."
—Scroll of Beginnings
cards.original_text:
Flying
As long as Wonder is in your graveyard and you control an island, creatures you control have flying.

cards.name: Wormfang Behemoth
cards.text:
When Wormfang Behemoth enters the battlefield, exile all cards from your hand.
When Wormfang Behemoth leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to their owner's hand.
cards.original_text:
When Wormfang Behemoth comes into play, remove all cards in your hand from the game.
When Wormfang Behemoth leaves play, return the removed cards to their owner's hand.

cards.name: Wormfang Crab
cards.text:
Wormfang Crab can't be blocked.
When Wormfang Crab enters the battlefield, an opponent chooses a permanent you control other than Wormfang Crab and exiles it.
When Wormfang Crab leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
cards.original_text:
Wormfang Crab is unblockable.
When Wormfang Crab comes into play, an opponent chooses a permanent you control and removes it from the game.
When Wormfang Crab leaves play, return the removed card to play under its owner's control.

cards.name: Wormfang Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When Wormfang Drake enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile a creature you control other than Wormfang Drake.
When Wormfang Drake leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Wormfang Drake comes into play, sacrifice it unless you remove a creature you control other than Wormfang Drake from the game.
When Wormfang Drake leaves play, return the removed card to play under its owner's control.

cards.name: Wormfang Manta
cards.text:
Flying
When Wormfang Manta enters the battlefield, you skip your next turn.
When Wormfang Manta leaves the battlefield, you take an extra turn after this one.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Wormfang Manta comes into play, you skip your next turn.
When Wormfang Manta leaves play, you take an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Wormfang Newt
cards.text:
When Wormfang Newt enters the battlefield, exile a land you control.
When Wormfang Newt leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
cards.flavor: Spawned by mages emulating the insane.
cards.original_text:
When Wormfang Newt comes into play, remove a land you control from the game.
When Wormfang Newt leaves play, return the removed card to play under its owner's control.

cards.name: Wormfang Turtle
cards.text:
When Wormfang Turtle enters the battlefield, exile a land you control.
When Wormfang Turtle leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
cards.flavor: Chainer's admirers keep his dreams alive.
cards.original_text:
When Wormfang Turtle comes into play, remove a land you control from the game.
When Wormfang Turtle leaves play, return the removed card to play under its owner's control.

cards.name: Balthor the Defiled
cards.text:
Minion creatures get +1/+1.
{B}{B}{B}, Exile Balthor the Defiled: Each player returns all black and all red creature cards from their graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: He remembers enough of his life to weep for what he has lost.
cards.original_text:
All Minions get +1/+1.
{B}{B}{B}, Remove Balthor the Defiled from the game: Each player returns all black and all red creature cards from his or her graveyard to play.

rulings.text: The Legend rule only applies to two legendary permanents with identical names. If the names are different, even if they depict the same character, the rule does not apply.
you can only activate this ability if Balthor the Defiled is on the battlefield.

cards.name: Cabal Therapy
cards.text:
Choose a nonland card name. Target player reveals their hand and discards all cards with that name.
Flashback—Sacrifice a creature. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Name a nonland card. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards from it all cards with that name.
Flashback—Sacrifice a creature. (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

rulings.text: You name the card as Cabal Therapy resolves, not as you cast it. Then the targeted player reveals their hand and discards if appropriate. No player may choose to take actions between you naming the card and the targeted player revealing and discarding.

cards.name: Cabal Trainee
cards.text: Sacrifice Cabal Trainee: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Ah, a faceshredder. Very rare. Nearly unstoppable. Good luck"
—Cabal instructor
cards.original_text: Sacrifice Cabal Trainee: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Death Wish
cards.text: You may choose a card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand. You lose half your life, rounded up. Exile Death Wish.
cards.flavor: He wished for power, but not for the longevity to abuse it.
cards.original_text: Choose a card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand. You lose half your life, rounded up. Remove Death Wish from the game.

rulings.text: Can't acquire the Ante cards. They are considered still "in the game" as are cards in the library and the graveyard.
The choice is optional.
If you fail to find something, you still exile this.
If you fail to find something, you still lose half your life, rounded up.
Can't acquire cards that are phased out.
You can't acquire exiled cards because those cards are still in one of the game's zones.
In a sanctioned event, a card that's "outside the game" is one that's in your sideboard. In an unsanctioned event, you may choose any card from your collection.

cards.name: Earsplitting Rats
cards.text:
When Earsplitting Rats enters the battlefield, each player discards a card.
Discard a card: Regenerate Earsplitting Rats.
cards.flavor: Rats come in one amount: too many.
cards.original_text:
When Earsplitting Rats comes into play, each player discards a card from his or her hand.
Discard a card from your hand: Regenerate Earsplitting Rats.

cards.name: Filth
cards.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
As long as Filth is in your graveyard and you control a Swamp, creatures you control have swampwalk.
cards.flavor:
"As the portal closed, Filth oozed through. The stench of evil followed it in."
—Scroll of Beginnings
cards.original_text:
Swampwalk
As long as Filth is in your graveyard and you control a swamp, creatures you control have swampwalk.

cards.name: Grave Consequences
cards.text:
Each player may exile any number of cards from their graveyard. Then each player loses 1 life for each card in their graveyard.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"You call that a nightmare?"
—Braids, dementia summoner
cards.original_text:
Each player may remove any number of cards in his or her graveyard from the game. Then each player loses 1 life for each card in his or her graveyard.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Guiltfeeder
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever Guiltfeeder attacks and isn't blocked, defending player loses 1 life for each card in their graveyard.
cards.original_text:
Guiltfeeder can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.
Whenever Guiltfeeder attacks and isn't blocked, defending player loses 1 life for each card in his or her graveyard.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.name: Masked Gorgon
cards.text:
Green creatures and white creatures have protection from Gorgons.
Threshold — Masked Gorgon has protection from green and from white as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.original_text:
Green creatures and white creatures have protection from Gorgons.
Threshold Masked Gorgon has protection from green and from white. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Morality Shift
cards.text: Exchange your graveyard and library. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The mind sings, though at times it sings a dirge.
cards.original_text: Exchange your graveyard and library. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: This spell does work if either your graveyard or library is empty.
You can choose the order of the cards being placed into the graveyard.

cards.name: Rats' Feast
cards.text: Exile X target cards from a single graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"That does it—I quit"
—Cabal grave robber
cards.original_text: Remove X target cards in a single graveyard from the game.

cards.name: Stitch Together
cards.text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Threshold — Return that card from your graveyard to the battlefield instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.original_text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Threshold Instead return that card from your graveyard to play. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

rulings.text: Checks the number of cards in your graveyard when it starts resolving. You may drop below seven cards during resolution, but that won't stop it from resolving.

cards.name: Sutured Ghoul
cards.text:
Trample
As Sutured Ghoul enters the battlefield, exile any number of creature cards from your graveyard.
Sutured Ghoul's power is equal to the total power of the exiled cards and its toughness is equal to their total toughness.
cards.original_text:
Trample 
As Sutured Ghoul comes into play, remove any number of creature cards in your graveyard from the game.
Sutured Ghoul's power is equal to the total power of the removed cards and its toughness is equal to their total toughness. (A * on a card not in play is 0.)

rulings.text: If any of the creature cards you exile has a characteristic-defining ability that defines its power and/or toughness, that ability will apply. For example, if Dungrove Elder is exiled this way, its power and toughness while it's in exile are equal to the number of Forests you control, and Sutured Ghoul's power and toughness will change as the number of Forests you control changes. If the characteristic-defining ability can't be applied (for instance, it relies on a choice made as the card enters the battlefield), then use 0.
In zones other than the battlefield, Sutured Ghoul's power and toughness are each 0.
You can't have Sutured Ghoul exile itself, even if it's entering the battlefield from your graveyard.

cards.name: Toxic Stench
cards.text:
Target nonblack creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, instead destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.original_text:
Target nonblack creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Threshold Instead destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Treacherous Vampire
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Treacherous Vampire attacks or blocks, sacrifice it unless you exile a card from your graveyard.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Treacherous Vampire gets +2/+2 and has "When Treacherous Vampire dies, you lose 6 life."
cards.original_text:
Flying
Whenever Treacherous Vampire attacks or blocks, sacrifice it unless you remove a card in your graveyard from the game.
Threshold Treacherous Vampire gets +2/+2 and has "When Treacherous Vampire is put into a graveyard from play, you lose 6 life."

cards.name: Treacherous Werewolf
cards.text: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Treacherous Werewolf gets +2/+2 and has "When Treacherous Werewolf dies, you lose 4 life."
cards.original_text: Threshold Treacherous Werewolf gets +2/+2 and has "When Treacherous Werewolf is put into a graveyard from play, you lose 4 life." (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

rulings.text: The Threshold ability can't count this card (soon to be in the graveyard) when checking for Threshold.

cards.name: Anger
cards.text:
Haste
As long as Anger is in your graveyard and you control a Mountain, creatures you control have haste.
cards.flavor:
"For its time as a mortal, Anger chose a shell of boiling rock."
—Scroll of Beginnings
cards.original_text:
Haste
As long as Anger is in your graveyard and you control a mountain, creatures you control have haste.

rulings.text: The timestamp for the "in your graveyard" ability is set at the time that this card goes to your graveyard, regardless of whether you control a Mountain at that time.

cards.name: Arcane Teachings
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to any target."
cards.flavor: Dwarves may teach at the speed of stone, but their results are solid.
cards.original_text: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

cards.name: Barbarian Bully
cards.text: Discard a card at random: Barbarian Bully gets +2/+2 until end of turn unless a player has Barbarian Bully deal 4 damage to them. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: "Out of my way!"
cards.original_text: Discard a card at random from your hand: Barbarian Bully gets +2/+2 until end of turn unless a player has Barbarian Bully deal 4 damage to him or her. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Book Burning
cards.text: Any player may have Book Burning deal 6 damage to them. If no one does, target player puts the top six cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: The wizard's spellbook was full of burning questions.
cards.original_text: Unless a player has Book Burning deal 6 damage to him or her, put the top six cards of target player's library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Breaking Point
cards.text: Any player may have Breaking Point deal 6 damage to them. If no one does, destroy all creatures. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: "Enough!"
cards.original_text: Destroy all creatures unless a player has Breaking Point deal 6 damage to him or her. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Browbeat
cards.text: Any player may have Browbeat deal 5 damage to them. If no one does, target player draws three cards.
cards.flavor:
"Even the threat of power has power."
—Jeska, warrior adept
cards.original_text: Unless a player has Browbeat deal 5 damage to him or her, target player draws three cards.

cards.name: Burning Wish
cards.text: You may choose a sorcery card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Burning Wish.
cards.flavor: She wished for a weapon, but not for the skill to wield it.
cards.original_text: Choose a sorcery card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Remove Burning Wish from the game.

rulings.text: Can't acquire the Ante cards. They are considered still "in the game" as are cards in the library and the graveyard.
The choice is optional.
If you fail to find something, you still exile this.
Can't acquire cards that are phased out.
You can't acquire exiled cards because those cards are still in one of the game's zones.
In a sanctioned event, a card that's "outside the game" is one that's in your sideboard. In an unsanctioned event, you may choose any card from your collection.

cards.name: Dwarven Bloodboiler
cards.text: Tap an untapped Dwarf you control: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: His battle cry unleashes an avalanche of dwarves.
cards.original_text: Tap an untapped Dwarf you control: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

rulings.text: The ability can be activated the turn it enters the battlefield because the ability does not use the {T} symbol.
Yes, it can tap itself.

cards.name: Dwarven Driller
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target land unless its controller has Dwarven Driller deal 2 damage to them.
cards.flavor:
"Drill the planet, it's no trouble:
Mining granite, making rubble."
—Dwarven drilling song
cards.original_text: {T}: Destroy target land unless its controller has Dwarven Driller deal 2 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Dwarven Scorcher
cards.text: Sacrifice Dwarven Scorcher: Dwarven Scorcher deals 1 damage to target creature unless that creature's controller has Dwarven Scorcher deal 2 damage to them.
cards.flavor: Barbarians invented the blaze of glory. Dwarves perfected it.
cards.original_text: Sacrifice Dwarven Scorcher: Dwarven Scorcher deals 1 damage to target creature unless that creature's controller has Dwarven Scorcher deal 2 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Ember Shot
cards.text:
Ember Shot deals 3 damage to any target.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Dwarves bring poor coal to market, use good coal in their homes, and throw their best coal away.
cards.original_text:
Ember Shot deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Firecat Blitz
cards.text:
Create X 1/1 red Elemental Cat creature tokens with haste. Exile them at the beginning of the next end step.
Flashback—{R}{R}, Sacrifice X Mountains. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Put X 1/1 red Cat creature tokens with haste into play. Remove them from the game at end of turn.
Flashback—{R}{R}, Sacrifice X mountains. (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Flaring Pain
cards.text:
Damage can't be prevented this turn.
Flashback {R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor:
"I don't rub salt in wounds. I use sulfur."
—Matoc, lavamancer
cards.original_text:
Damage can't be prevented this turn.
Flashback {R} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

rulings.text: Spells and abilities that replace or redirect damage are not affected by this card.
The "damage can't be prevented" statement overrides all forms of preventing damage. Damage prevention spells and abilities can still be cast and activated, they just don't do anything.

cards.name: Fledgling Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Fledgling Dragon gets +3/+3 and has "{R}: Fledgling Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
cards.original_text:
Flying
Threshold Fledgling Dragon gets +3/+3 and has "{R}: Fledgling Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn." (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Goretusk Firebeast
cards.text: When Goretusk Firebeast enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: As a youth, Kamahl took one for a pet. His hair has yet to grow back.
cards.original_text: When Goretusk Firebeast comes into play, it deals 4 damage to target player.

cards.name: Infectious Rage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-1.
When enchanted creature dies, choose a creature at random Infectious Rage can enchant. Return Infectious Rage to the battlefield attached to that creature.
cards.original_text:
Enchanted creature gets +2/-1.
When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard, choose a creature at random Infectious Rage can enchant. Return Infectious Rage to play enchanting that creature.

rulings.text: When this card returns to the battlefield, it is put onto the battlefield on the creature without targeting it, so it can be placed on a creature with Shroud.
You can't return this card to the battlefield onto something it can't enchant. For example, you can't place this card on a permanent with protection from red.

cards.name: Jeska, Warrior Adept
cards.text:
First strike, haste
{T}: Jeska, Warrior Adept deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: "My brother and I both come from Balthor's forge. Kamahl has a temper of fire. I have a temper of steel."
cards.original_text:
First strike, haste
{T}: Jeska, Warrior Adept deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Lava Dart
cards.text:
Lava Dart deals 1 damage to any target.
Flashback—Sacrifice a Mountain. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Lava Dart deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Flashback—Sacrifice a mountain. (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Liberated Dwarf
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Liberated Dwarf: Target green creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Freed from their chains, these dwarves are bound only by honor.
cards.original_text: {R}, Sacrifice Liberated Dwarf: Target green creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Lightning Surge
cards.text:
Lightning Surge deals 4 damage to any target.
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, instead Lightning Surge deals 6 damage to that permanent or player and the damage can't be prevented.
Flashback {5}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Lightning Surge deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
Threshold Instead Lightning Surge deals 6 damage to that creature or player and the damage can't be prevented.
Flashback {5}{R}{R} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

rulings.text: It either deals 4 damage or 6 damage. It does not deal 10 damage.
At the time this spell is resolving, it is on the stack and not in the graveyard. This means that you should not count this card when determining whether the Threshold effect occurs.

cards.name: Planar Chaos
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Planar Chaos.
Whenever a player casts a spell, that player flips a coin. If they lose the flip, counter that spell.
cards.original_text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Planar Chaos.
Whenever a player plays a spell, that player flips a coin. If he or she loses the flip, counter that spell.

cards.name: Shaman's Trance
cards.text: Other players can't cast spells or play lands from their graveyards this turn. You may play cards from other players' graveyards this turn as though those cards were in your graveyard.
cards.original_text: Until end of turn, other players can't play cards from their graveyards, and you may play cards from other players' graveyards as though they were in your graveyard.

rulings.text: This card does not allow you to activate the abilities of cards in other people's graveyards.
You can use Flashback on cards to cast them.

cards.name: Soulgorger Orgg
cards.text:
Trample
When Soulgorger Orgg enters the battlefield, you lose all but 1 life.
When Soulgorger Orgg leaves the battlefield, you gain life equal to the life you lost when it entered the battlefield.
cards.original_text:
Trample
When Soulgorger Orgg comes into play, you lose all but 1 life.
When Soulgorger Orgg leaves play, you gain life equal to the life you lost when it came into play.

cards.name: Spellgorger Barbarian
cards.text:
When Spellgorger Barbarian enters the battlefield, discard a card at random.
When Spellgorger Barbarian leaves the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: The epidemic insanity had a lasting effect on certain barbarians—but no one noticed.
cards.original_text:
When Spellgorger Barbarian comes into play, discard a card at random from your hand.
When Spellgorger Barbarian leaves play, draw a card.

cards.name: Swelter
cards.text: Swelter deals 2 damage to each of two target creatures.
cards.flavor: No circle has a beginning, but many have foreseeable ends.
cards.original_text: Swelter deals 2 damage to each of two target creatures.

rulings.text: You can't cast this spell unless you have two different legal targets.

cards.name: Swirling Sandstorm
cards.text: Threshold — Swirling Sandstorm deals 5 damage to each creature without flying if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: As dust swept out, vultures swept in.
cards.original_text: Threshold Swirling Sandstorm deals 5 damage to each creature without flying. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

rulings.text: This card does nothing if you don't have seven cards in your graveyard when it resolves.

cards.name: Worldgorger Dragon
cards.text:
Flying, trample
When Worldgorger Dragon enters the battlefield, exile all other permanents you control.
When Worldgorger Dragon leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to the battlefield under their owners' control.
cards.original_text:
Flying, trample
When Worldgorger Dragon comes into play, remove all other permanents you control from the game.
When Worldgorger Dragon leaves play, return the removed cards to play under their owners' control.

rulings.text: It is possible for Worldgorger Dragon to leave the battlefield before its "enters the battlefield" trigger resolves. If this happens, then the "leaves the battlefield" trigger will have nothing to return. Then its "enters the battlefield" trigger resolves, and all other permanents you control are exiled forever.

If an Aura is exiled with Worldgorger Dragon, the player who controls the Aura when it enters the battlefield chooses what it will enchant. It doesn't have to go back to the same place. It can't enter the battlefield enchanting a permanent that enters the battlefield at the same time.

If Animate Dead is put onto the battlefield enchanting Worldgorger Dragon, Worldgorger Dragon's enters-the-battlefield trigger will exile Animate Dead, which causes you to sacrifice Worldgorger Dragon, which causes Animate Dead to return to the battlefield attached to a creature card in a graveyard of your choice. If you can choose a creature card other than Worldgorger Dragon, you must do so after as many iterations of this loop as you'd like. If you can't choose a different card, and no player chooses to break the loop, the game ends in a draw.

cards.name: Anurid Barkripper
cards.text: Threshold — Anurid Barkripper gets +2/+2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: When it croaks, so do you.
cards.original_text: Threshold Anurid Barkripper gets +2/+2. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Anurid Swarmsnapper
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
{1}{G}: Anurid Swarmsnapper can block an additional creature this turn.
cards.flavor: Anurids have the problem of airborne invaders licked.
cards.original_text:
Anurid Swarmsnapper may block as though it had flying.
{1}{G}: Anurid Swarmsnapper may block an additional creature this turn.

cards.name: Battlefield Scrounger
cards.text: Threshold — Put three cards from your graveyard on the bottom of your library: Battlefield Scrounger gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn and only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.original_text: Threshold Put three cards from your graveyard on the bottom of your library: Battlefield Scrounger gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Play this ability only once each turn. (Play this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

rulings.text: Check the number of cards in your graveyard before activating the ability. If activating the ability causes that number to fall below seven, the ability still resolves as normal.

cards.name: Brawn
cards.text:
Trample
As long as Brawn is in your graveyard and you control a Forest, creatures you control have trample.
cards.flavor:
"'I have arrived,' bellowed Brawn, and the plane shuddered."
—Scroll of Beginnings
cards.original_text:
Trample
As long as Brawn is in your graveyard and you control a forest, creatures you control have trample.

cards.name: Canopy Claws
cards.text:
Target creature loses flying until end of turn.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Target creature loses flying until end of turn.
Flashback {G} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Centaur Rootcaster
cards.text: Whenever Centaur Rootcaster deals combat damage to a player, you may search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.original_text: Whenever Centaur Rootcaster deals combat damage to a player, you may search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Crush of Wurms
cards.text:
Create three 6/6 green Wurm creature tokens.
Flashback {9}{G}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Put three 6/6 green Wurm creature tokens into play.
Flashback {9}{G}{G}{G} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Elephant Guide
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature dies, create a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.
cards.flavor: Nature's strength outlives the strong.
cards.original_text:
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard, put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token into play.

rulings.text: If Elephant Guide enchants an opponent's creature, you get the Elephant when that creature dies.

cards.name: Epic Struggle
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control twenty or more creatures, you win the game.
cards.flavor:
"If our foes will not listen to words, perhaps hooves and claws will make them take notice."
—Seton, centaur druid
cards.original_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control twenty or more creatures, you win the game.

rulings.text: To win, you must control 20 or more creatures both at the beginning of upkeep and when it resolves.

cards.name: Erhnam Djinn
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target non-Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next upkeep. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: He provides a safe path to nowhere.
cards.original_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target non-Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next upkeep.

rulings.text: In multiplayer games you can choose a different player's creature each upkeep. You are forced to pick a creature that some opponent controls if there is at least one creature on the battlefield that is a legal target.
If you have more than one Djinn, you can have all of them target the same creature with their ability.
If there are no creatures your opponent controls to target at the beginning of your upkeep, ignore this ability.

cards.name: Exoskeletal Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+X, where X is the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
cards.flavor:
"We use only what we need—but in times of strife, our need becomes great."
—Centaur warrior
cards.original_text: Enchanted creature gets +X/+X, where X is the number of creature cards in all graveyards.

rulings.text: The value of X changes as the number of creatures cards in graveyards changes.

cards.name: Folk Medicine
cards.text:
You gain 1 life for each creature you control.
Flashback {1}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: Sometimes the healers need healing.
cards.original_text:
You gain 1 life for each creature you control.
Flashback {1}{W} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Forcemage Advocate
cards.text: {T}: Return target card from an opponent's graveyard to their hand. Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: "Our unity renews our strength."
cards.original_text: {T}: Return target card in an opponent's graveyard to his or her hand. Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Genesis
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Genesis is in your graveyard, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"First through the Riftstone was Genesis—and the world was lifeless no more."
—Scroll of Beginnings
cards.original_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Genesis is in your graveyard, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Giant Warthog
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor:
"When the Ancestor saw the cruelty her human children were capable of, Her fury shook the world. From this outburst sprang the warthogs."
—Nomad myth
cards.original_text: Trample

cards.name: Grizzly Fate
cards.text:
Create two 2/2 green Bear creature tokens.
Threshold — Create four 2/2 green Bear creature tokens instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
Flashback {5}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Put two 2/2 green Bear creature tokens into play.
Threshold Instead put four 2/2 green Bear creature tokens into play.
Flashback {5}{G}{G} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

rulings.text: At the time this spell is resolving, it is on the stack and not in the graveyard. This means that you should not count this card when determining whether the Threshold effect occurs.

cards.name: Harvester Druid
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color that a land you control could produce.
cards.flavor: "In the end, the same soil lies atop the field, within the mountain, and under the sea."
cards.original_text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land you control could produce.

cards.name: Ironshell Beetle
cards.text: When Ironshell Beetle enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor:
"Why waste time creating weapons? Nature provides us with all we need."
—Centaur warrior
cards.original_text: When Ironshell Beetle comes into play, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Krosan Reclamation
cards.text:
Target player shuffles up to two target cards from their graveyard into their library.
Flashback {1}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Target player shuffles up to two target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.
Flashback {1}{G} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Krosan Wayfarer
cards.text: Sacrifice Krosan Wayfarer: You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"The Krosan Forest lives, and druids are its seeds."
—Seton, centaur druid
cards.original_text: Sacrifice Krosan Wayfarer: Put a land card from your hand into play.

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

cards.name: Living Wish
cards.text: You may choose a creature or land card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Living Wish.
cards.flavor: He wished for growth, but not for a way to control it.
cards.original_text: Choose a creature or land card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Remove Living Wish from the game.

rulings.text: Can't acquire the Ante cards. They are considered still "in the game" as are cards in the library and the graveyard.
The choice is optional.
If you fail to find something, you still exile this.
Can't acquire cards that are phased out.
You can't acquire exiled cards because those cards are still in one of the game's zones.
In a sanctioned event, a card that's "outside the game" is one that's in your sideboard. In an unsanctioned event, you may choose any card from your collection.

cards.name: Nantuko Tracer
cards.text: When Nantuko Tracer enters the battlefield, you may put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
Your past is a map to where you will go.
—Nantuko teaching
cards.original_text: When Nantuko Tracer comes into play, you may put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.

cards.name: Nullmage Advocate
cards.text: {T}: Return two target cards from an opponent's graveyard to their hand. Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: "Our unity unmasks your deceit."
cards.original_text: {T}: Return two target cards in an opponent's graveyard to his or her hand. Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

rulings.text: You can't activate this ability unless a single opponent has at least two cards in their graveyard to target.

cards.name: Phantom Centaur
cards.text:
Protection from black
Phantom Centaur enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Centaur, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Centaur.
cards.original_text:
Protection from black
Phantom Centaur comes into play with three +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Centaur, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Centaur.

rulings.text: If this card is going to take damage from a black source, you can choose to apply Protection from Black's damage prevention ability prior to applying this card's built-in ability. This means you don't have to remove a counter.
If this card takes damage from multiple sources at once (for example if it is blocked by multiple creatures in combat), it only loses one counter.
If unpreventable damage is applied to this card, you still remove a counter even though the prevention fails.
Remove one counter each time it would be damaged. If it was going to take more than one point of damage, you prevent all the damage and still only remove one counter.
The damage prevention ability works even if it has no counters, as long as some effect keeps its toughness above zero.

cards.name: Phantom Nantuko
cards.text:
Trample
Phantom Nantuko enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Nantuko, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Nantuko.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Phantom Nantuko.
cards.original_text:
Trample
Phantom Nantuko comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Nantuko, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Nantuko.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Phantom Nantuko.

rulings.text: If this card takes damage from multiple sources at once (for example if it is blocked by multiple creatures in combat), it only loses one counter.
If unpreventable damage is applied to this card, you still remove a counter even though the prevention fails.
Remove one counter each time it would be damaged. If it was going to take more than one point of damage, you prevent all the damage and still only remove one counter.
The damage prevention ability works even if it has no counters, as long as some effect keeps its toughness above zero.

cards.name: Phantom Tiger
cards.text:
Phantom Tiger enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Tiger, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Tiger.
cards.original_text:
Phantom Tiger comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Tiger, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Tiger.

rulings.text: If this card takes damage from multiple sources at once (for example if it is blocked by multiple creatures in combat), it only loses one counter.
If unpreventable damage is applied to this card, you still remove a counter even though the prevention fails.
Remove one counter each time it would be damaged. If it was going to take more than one point of damage, you prevent all the damage and still only remove one counter.
The damage prevention ability works even if it has no counters, as long as some effect keeps its toughness above zero.

cards.name: Seedtime
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during your turn.
Take an extra turn after this one if an opponent cast a blue spell this turn.
cards.flavor:
The hippo grows wings to fight the condor.
—Nantuko teaching
cards.original_text:
Play Seedtime only during your turn.
Take an extra turn after this one if an opponent played a blue spell this turn.

rulings.text: You only get an extra turn if an opponent cast a blue spell this turn prior to this spell resolving. Note that "casting" a spell only requires it to be announced, so an unresolved spell still counts as having been cast.

cards.name: Serene Sunset
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage X target creatures would deal this turn.
cards.flavor: The armies paused, silent, as the warriors reflected on the sunsets of their youth.
cards.original_text: Prevent all combat damage X target creatures would deal this turn.

cards.name: Sudden Strength
cards.text:
Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: The Mirari's magic transformed the Krosan Forest—and its inhabitants.
cards.original_text:
Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Sylvan Safekeeper
cards.text: Sacrifice a land: Target creature you control gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"How could someone so small cause so much trouble?"
—Nomad sentry
cards.original_text: Sacrifice a land: Target creature you control can't be the target of spells or abilities this turn.

cards.name: Thriss, Nantuko Primus
cards.text: {G}, {T}: Target creature gets +5/+5 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "When you live for others, you live for yourself."
cards.original_text: {G}, {T}: Target creature gets +5/+5 until end of turn.

cards.name: Tunneler Wurm
cards.text: Discard a card: Regenerate Tunneler Wurm.
cards.flavor: If an anurid's lucky, it'll find a warm tunnel for bedtime. If a wurm's lucky, it'll find a warm anurid for breakfast.
cards.original_text: Discard a card from your hand: Regenerate Tunneler Wurm.

cards.name: Venomous Vines
cards.text: Destroy target enchanted permanent.
cards.flavor:
"True strength comes from within. The false promise of unnatural power only incurs Krosa's wrath."
—Seton, centaur druid
cards.original_text: Destroy target enchanted permanent.

cards.name: Anurid Brushhopper
cards.text: Discard two cards: Exile Anurid Brushhopper. Return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: It's so tough it can frighten itself into hiding.
cards.original_text: Discard two cards from your hand: Remove Anurid Brushhopper from the game. Return it to play under its owner's control at end of turn.

cards.name: Hunting Grounds
cards.text: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Hunting Grounds has "Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield."
cards.flavor: In the heavy hush of Krosa, drawing on mana is like ringing a dinner bell.
cards.original_text: Threshold Whenever an opponent plays a spell, you may put a creature card from your hand into play. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Mirari's Wake
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana of any type that land produced.
cards.flavor: The land drank power from the Mirari as though it had thirsted forever.
cards.original_text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana to your mana pool of any type that land produced.

cards.name: Phantom Nishoba
cards.text:
Trample
Phantom Nishoba enters the battlefield with seven +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever Phantom Nishoba deals damage, you gain that much life.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Nishoba, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Nishoba.

Trample
Phantom Nishoba comes into play with seven +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever Phantom Nishoba deals damage, you gain that much life.
If damage would be dealt to Phantom Nishoba, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Nishoba.

cards.name: Krosan Verge
cards.text:
Krosan Verge enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {C}.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Krosan Verge: Search your library for a Forest card and a Plains card and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.original_text:
Krosan Verge comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Krosan Verge: Search your library for a forest card and a plains card and put them into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Nantuko Monastery
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
Threshold — {G}{W}: Nantuko Monastery becomes a 4/4 green and white Insect Monk creature with first strike until end of turn. It's still a land. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.original_text:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
Threshold {G}{W}: Nantuko Monastery becomes a 4/4 green and white creature with first strike until end of turn. It's still a land. (Play this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.name: Riftstone Portal
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
As long as Riftstone Portal is in your graveyard, lands you control have "{T}: Add {G} or {W}."
cards.original_text:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
As long as Riftstone Portal is in your graveyard, lands you control have "{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool."
